Articles.Content: Cool wireframe!

Why re-do Gemini if you don't even have Mercury pod yet?

The Mk1 pod isn't good enough?

It looks almost identical but needs a different interieur.

Some may ask why are you redoing it?

1. The pod is still largely Tosh's, with some tweaks and re-texturing I did early on. I would really like this mod to be a showpiece of my own artwork, and not just my ability to tag someone else's stuff. So it got remade.

2. Also the interior I did never fully lined up with the exterior, now it lines up perfectly.

3. The original was in the wrong scale as well. Now all the parts will have their standard scale at 1:1 with no funky rescaleFactor business in the cfg.

Also Gemini is where this mod started so it gets updated first, and always will be...

Stage 1

Redoing Gemini and re-exporting all the parts so they are a consistent size and can re-use common textures. This should help with memory and performance.

Stage 2

Big G, Maned Orbital Labritory, Agena Target vehicle, and Winged Gemini.

Stage 3

Mercury capsule, Atlas launcher with proper engines and decoupler.

I also I reserve the right to change the priority and order of these items when and how I see fit.

Also Gemini is where this mod started so it gets updated first, and always will be...

Happy news...and for me special the stage 3!!!

Thanks!

Winged Gemini!!!

Love it.
I actually would like to see other peoples designs for a winged Gemini that could glide and land on a runway after a launch. Not an official challenge, just seemed like a fun thing to do.
I did a winged Gemini with your pod a while back, but don't think I kept any pictures of it.

A winged Gemini? The Paraglider Gemini? THE PARAGLIDER GEMINI??

YESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYES.

Please oh please oh pretty please.

A winged Gemini? The Paraglider Gemini? THE PARAGLIDER GEMINI??

YESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYESYES.

Please oh please oh pretty please.

If you read a few posts up you would see that its not possible

Before I start modeling them I wanted to get opinions on wings for Gemini?

So after some research I found out that the glider parachute version of gemini is not real practical in KSP, not without a custom mod anyway, but with my experimentation a static winged Gemini is possible.

Frizzank, you going to put the reticule/ scale back on the windows? i found those quite useful for docking.
The window scale is for setting pitch relative to the horizon during reentry, if I remember correctly, but it does come in handy for other things.

The window scale is for setting pitch relative to the horizon during reentry, if I remember correctly, but it does come in handy for other things.

Yea i know its not meant for docking, but its very good to help line everything up.

Yes its coming back, although I was going to make it smaller so it was more like a cross-hair on a heads up display because its gradation isn't really all that useful.

Yea i know its not meant for docking, but its very good to help line everything up.

Docking is really all I use it for;)

Edited August 21, 2013 by frizzank
I really love the work you have done on that capsule. I can't wait to use it in another video! Having had a brief exposure to 3d modeling I know how much work you threw into this. Well done!

Comparison shots between old and new Gemini Pods

First up the new one is twice the resolution as the old one. Look Rivets!!!

Made the proportions a little better.

Next the new one will let you stack several parachutes inside the nose cone so you can use droges if you want.

I put the RCS thrusters on the pod where they belong, instead of on the nosecone.

Super wide large image!

http://i.imgur.com/l4f2JGF.jpg

Edited August 22, 2013 by frizzank
Will this one have working retro-rockets? Just a thought, their covers are visible, but they never worked on the old model.

Will this one have working retro-rockets? Just a thought, their covers are visible, but they never worked on the old model.

Um sure why not. They are probably not going to be functional in they way you want. Meaning that they will have to be manually extended and activated interdependently. Otherwise it would require a custom plugin...
That's fine with me. Manual operation would do, no need to complicate this.
New models look beautiful

When I put the RCS on the gemini main pod I get the SAS and key controles doing inverted controls when the pod has no attached parts? When it has attached parts it works normaly? The easy solution is to remove the sas on the pod, but I was wondering if any one knew a workaround?
Does the pod itself have innate RCS now, rather than adding the nose section with RCS as a separate part? I haven't had a chance to play with your new versions yet, sorry.

Does the pod itself have innate RCS now, rather than adding the nose section with RCS as a separate part? I haven't had a chance to play with your new versions yet, sorry.

Yes the pod im currently working on has it attached to it. I haven't released the new version yet.

It seems to be confused as to which thrust to fire once its just the pod. Later tonight I will post it here and see if anyone can help...

retro rockets would be kinda redundant unless you rearrange the rcs as well so they can act like the real geminis OAMS and have the rear thruster act as engines

i'd love this but it seems like a lot of work for a small change
Well zakkpaz is right no animated deploy able retro rockets then. Too bad they would have been fun.

Yes the pod im currently working on has it attached to it. I haven't released the new version yet.

It seems to be confused as to which thrust to fire once its just the pod. Later tonight I will post it here and see if anyone can help...

I actually found some added value in having the "nose" section with the RCS rings a separate part, especially when using the capsule as a general control pod rather than a historically-accurate piece.

But, isn't that piece supposed to jettison as part of the parachute deployment?
